<Review>A gem to find in Rancho. Great authentic Mexican food and enjoyed. We ate the red pozole and carne asada street tacos; both where very yummy. And, the chips and salsa were also fresh and homemade tasting. We felt like we part of the family at a family bbq. Great friendly service as well. These are my favorite store bought tamales ever! They taste homemade. Try the chicken or pork, promise they won't disappoint!<//Review>< gmap_id>

<resp>None</resp><text>My wife andI stopped in and I had the Carne asada taco plate, and my wife had the tamale plate. The tacos were a nice size with good flavor,  my wife had a chicken and a pork tamale though she couldn't finish the pork one so I got it,they were both good with just the right amount of masa.  I also had a cheese and Chile tamale which was very good. The beans definitely taste homemade and I finished them all which I don't always eat all my beans. The rice was nice and fluffy as well. They brought us freshly cooked chips which were great I was just hoping for a better dipping salsa. <Rating>5</Rating><text>REAL MEXICAN TAMALES! Seriously, THE best tamales this side of the border. AND they are made by hand. Do you know how many places I've tried in order to find a decent tamale? Over the years, at least 50! Every time a friend of mine would say "they have the best tamales over at _______" (pick a place) and I would go try them, only to be sadly disappointed. It was always a super thick layer of dry masa with a pinch of dry beef with too much sauce to try and mask the dryness! FINALLY, I came here to Mary's and I have hit the tamale jackpot! Da'yum! The masa is super moist and it's not thick. They put a thinner layer of masa around a GOOD amount of TENDER beef/pork/chicken. And just the right amount of sauce. Oh man! They are super moist and tender and SO GOOD!!! You won't be disappointed! (No, I promise, this is not an advertisement and I do not know the owners--I'm a foodie and this is just how I speak ü•¥) Oh, and customer service? The best! It is a "mom-and-pop" place with a kind, welcome, and relaxing atmosphere. HAPPY  EATING! üòâ  I'll post pics soon...</text>< pics>

Went for a pedicure with my teenage Granddaughter.  The nail person doing my pedicure acting like I was bothering him by just being there and giving him my business.  Rude and abrupt.  Then while finishing up my pedicure he washed off the pumice sponge and put it back in the drawer.  If you don't plan on reusing it then WHY wash it off.  Beware!  This is unsafe.  Those pumice sponges are made to be disposable for a reason.
We will not be back.  It's not worth the risk.

I gave my insurance a call and they gave me a list of 7 chiropractors that were available for new patients in my area, Dr. Mark being the furthest of them all. I did what anyone does these days and googled the names of the lists of doctors I was sent. All of the doctors that I googled had positive feedback but Dr. Mark had the most, for good reason.

I called and made a same day appointment where I came in, was quickly and throughly looked at. We came to the conclusion that we had pretty bad compression in my lower back. Dr. Mark drew up a treatment plan and we got to work.

After 2 weeks I'm back to feeling mobile again for the first time in nearly 2 years. I'm feeling much better than I have in a long while. Though I have yet to return to strenuous physical activity, I am slowly becoming confident in my ability to do so if I should choose to do so. <Rating>1< /Rating><date>1507844817133< /date>< Review>
Was treated here for several months and it just kinda sucked. Gabby used some TENS machine on me most of the time she asked me where I wanted them placed( they should know better than me). Than the "deep tissue" that massage was OK. I continued those 2 basic treatments for weeks with the occasional adjustment or chiropractic meeting with Marc Cafagna. Every time he would crack my neck or back.. It wouldn't feel right. On occasion would get severe headaches after he messed with my neck. I left the office with odd pains in never felt before. I was very worried.  Than I informed him that the chiropractic therapy wasn't working. We than stopped adjusting my neck and put me on a decompression machine. It worked fine. After continuing deep tissue, TENS machine and back adjustments for a few weeks he suddenly informed me that "I SHOULD BE BETTER WITHIN THE NEXT 4 VISITS" even though my pain level was still around a 5 out of 10. I decided to stop seeing that "doc" immediately. Now iam just receiving heavy pain meds to deal with this pain.< /Review>

< Review>
We joined 2 nights Grand Canyon and Lake Powell/Antelope Canyon bus tour (36 people in the same bus) this August. It was far more satisfied than expectation - time arrangement, route, the spots of sightseeing, many guidance for having fun, and especially the guide Lankun, called as "mama".
In terms of Grand Canyon and Antelope Canyon, recommend to go in the weekday in order to avoid too crowd.</Review>

<user_id>117166478908792565718<//user_id><name>Lily Song</name><Date>1526789135238<//Date><Rate>5< /Rate>< text>
This is my first time to do the bus tour to see Yellowstone and Grand Canyon. I was amazed by our tour lady Lankun who is very professional and knowledgeable. On the moment we got on the bus, she started to introduce the history of California, the railroad and highway system in US. For each stop, like Yellowstone, Bryce Canyon, Zion National Park, Antelope Canyon, Grand Canyon, she would tell us the history behind it, and also gave a lot of information about culture, geography, religion and nature animals. I felt this trip is not only a sight-seeing trip, but also very educational and interesting!
I noticed 50% of tourists on the bus are seniors who don‚Äôt speak English. Lankun took care of them with much detail and patience! She helped hotel check-in, WiFi connection, and meal ordering for those seniors. She even prepared boxes of bottle water for guests, only charged a small amount of fee(4 for $1), that saved me a lot of time and money on water.

The driver Quincy is a very nice, polite and hard working guy. He helped to load/unload each passenger‚Äôs luggage every day. We felt very comfortable and safe on the bus while he was driving.
This seven days tour trip is very fun and unforgettable. Highly recommend Lankun and Joy Holiday!<//text>

<username>bayani ang< /username><time>1527983415858< /time><rate>1< /rate><text>Joy holiday

I was one of travelers in the RY7 tour with Joy Holiday. It was the worst tour I‚Äôve ever been in my life. I‚Äôve done local tours and international tours before, and this is my first time to use Joy Holiday. Right from the morning of day 2 was a disaster. There was a delay of not one, not two, but 4 1/2 hours of delay. According to the tour director was a transmission problem. Alibis for the 4 1/2 hours delay were: it was Sunday, and it‚Äôs Mother‚Äôs Day. As a traveler any delay, or call it anything outside of the itinerary is an inconvenience. More inconvenience like: no porter to carry your luggage into your room, and out to your bus. No earphone radios so that if you‚Äôre slow or away from the group/tour director you miss the information about the place. Even some of the information are inaccurate. Anything you need to pay like an option has to be paid in cash. Even the driver is sometimes on the phone.  This is illegal and puts all of us at risk of accident.The worst thing that happened from this tour is that the tour director interpreted a review, from a couple about the delay, as a criticism. He even mentioned in the PA inside the bus. The tour director mentioned that the 4 1/2 delay was because it was Sunday and Mother‚Äôs Day, and that getting a chartered bus was very expensive and lost so much money on this tour. This is when he said ‚Äúnot everybody appreciate this, some criticize this‚Äù. This tells me that this tour operator or management is only for profits. Instead of learning from reviews of travelers and improve the way they run their business, they take it as criticism. So for my review this tour company, Joy Holiday, is the worst I have travelled with.  I hope many of you can read this before the owner takes this offline.</text>< Pictures>

< resp>
{'time': 1528132890118, 'text': 'Dear Bayani, thank you for expressing your views, we regret that the bus had downed the second morning of the 7 day Rushmore trip at the hotel in Nevada, and that it had caused a delay of departure that morning.  As the group waited in the hotel, we called every bus company we could find for a rescue bus since 6am that Sunday morning on Mother\'s day.   However, down in the small town of Wendover NV, the nearest major city was Salt Lake City.  Luckily we had been able to secure a bus and a driver to come help.  The tour went on smoothly afterwards and everything we had intended to see and do got done.  We have the invoice from Smith Power Systems in SLC, indicating that the break down was caused by a faulty internal wire which failed, and was impossible to detect from inspections or maintenance.  The bus was a 2016 Vanhool which has a new vehicle value at over half a million.  The tour guide Frank had tried to explain to the group, that on a Sunday, especially Mother\'s Day, it was extremely challenging to find last minute buses, and yet we\'ve found it.  We immediately confirmed it, even at a very high cost which is 3.75 per mile.  The cost of the rescue bus turned out to be over $6000 for 4 days while our bus is down getting fixed, but as long as we take care of the group needs, we do not care about the cost.  In no way was the guide trying to express the need to save money at all, instead, we just wanted to get the problem solved at all cost.  Our driver did use the phone with headphone jacks on occasions because of the bus related issues that he had to address, to ensure that the equipment needs gets clearly communicated.  Our drivers would not at all endanger anyone including himself for talking on the phone while driving.\n\nYes there were no luggage portage service for most of the hotels used on the 7 days, 6 nights trip.  I apologize for that, but cities and towns like Casper WY, Sheridan WY, West Yellowstone WY, Pocatello ID, it\'s hard to find hotels that provide portage unless we are staying in hotels like Hilton or Marriott. However, when our tour fare is only $698 per person double occupancy for 7 days, 6 nights trip, it\'s unrealistic to expect that.  We shall look into charging more and upgrade, and offer higher end itineraries for the near future.  Also, I have looked into the possibility of offering individual earphones and receivers for each passenger so that the guide can talk to the group while out on foot with the group, for the premium tours that we will start to offer.  I personally love those, great suggestion!\n\nPaying for optional excursions shouldn\'t be a hassle, and credit card payment should be offered by the guide with a 4 percent credit card merchant use fee that will be collected from the passengers, unless paid with cash.  It saves the passengers money but I realize that some would not mind paying that for the convenience, so we will have our guide readily equipped with card swipers on the bus.\n\nThe guide "criticizing" about any other negative comments is not what we heard from other passengers we\'ve interviewed.  He said that, in spite of doing our absolute best, with all the financial loss we had to take, there are still some who still do not understand the fact that the breakdown was not due to the fault of the tour operator, and wants to rate the company not on what it had done to remedy an unforeseeable, non preventable situation, but on the frustration of the breakdown itself.\n\nWe live in a place and time where opinions can be freely expressed out in the open for thousands to speculate, which is a great thing.  However, if a story is to be told to the world, it owes the world to reflect the whole truth, setting aside opinions with facts.  We do not mind being judged and given a one star rating, if it truly reflects what we deserve.  By the way, it is not possible for us to remove a comment here. Only the writers themselves can.'}< /resp>

< Text>
My parens join the YA7 tour group to Yellowstone with tour guide Ms Guo (MAMA) and driver Quincy. They are super satisfied.
The whole itinerary is very well designed and organized. It balanced with scenic tour, leisure time, breaks and travel time on the bus. They enjoyed a lot of beautiful views and activities and did not feel tired. The bus they have is a nice luxury one, very comfortable. All the fees and options are clearly stated, no hidden fees.
The tour guide is awesome! She takes care each guest in the tour likes a mom. She had all the info for the next day send out the day before by messages. It includes the time, breaks, the interesting points, maps and eating. Sometimes even has tips for photo shooting for a specific place. She has great knowledge of the places they are going. On the spot, she takes pics for everyone. And she is also a good at photography herself. She shares nice pics with the group later each night. She also helps guest with language difficulties with prepared translation text message and on demand. The driver is also responsible and very familiar with the route.
Over all an excellent experience. I will definitely recommend joy holiday to everyone. And I am planning to join this tour myself!</Text>

<Name>Maneesh Agarwal<//Name>< time>
1514928168491<//time>
<Rating>5<//Rating><text>We did Grand Circle tour of Canyons in Utah, Colorado, Monument Valley, Horseshoe Bend, Antelope Canyon, Bryce/Zion NP, Arches NP, Mesa Verde NP during Christmas vacations 2017- very memorable trip. Our Driver was great - Quincy. Tour was made really enjoyable - mainly because of our tour guide - Lankun (dearly called as Mama). I have done one similar tour earlier, Tour guide makes a big difference, hope Joy Special train other guide under her. I am from India, however, Mama English was perfect for us. I have done similar bus trip earlier in the year in July to Yellow Stone, however, this one was much more pleasant. What makes this trip pleasant
1.	Mama (Lankun) repeats itinerary at start of the day, and at end of the day; however, she is not doing to just shout out instructions, which most other guides do, but with genuine concern and care of people on the tour. As an example, she would preface her speech that I know some of you might find it annoying, however, I have seen people leave their iPhone, jackets, and other valuables in bus. She does not stop there, she would sweep the bus, and next day she would show up with some valuables left behind.
2.	Mama does not just stay in the front of bus, she routinely walks through bus, and asking people if they have any other questions and concerns, and tries to accommodate that.
3.	Mama is curious, and she has really learnt all these places, and picked up nuances of various cities. She knew the states we travelled to, and history of National Parks we were visiting and shared them with lot of enthusiasm. She further mentioned that she visited most of these places, in her own car to further explore and wanted to share her findings with rest of us.
4.	Mama has ideal selections of DVDs, some of them are documentary, and some of them are light comedies. She knows when people are tired or kids might be cranky, her movie selection was great, educational and fun.
5.	Even in our bus there were only 10 % vegetarians (including me ‚Äì and I was not worried about food), she would take lot of pains, calling ahead in the cities or other tour busses ahead to find out what is open on Christmas day or Christmas eve for Vegetarians. Her efforts here are above and beyond one expect from a guide.
6.	She created Whatsapp and other groups to connect with people during the trip, and would put up seating arrangements, and if time of departure changes next day. This is again truly remarkable.
7.	She would stop at grocery stores so that people in bus, if they need food or were not prepared for harsh winter and wanted to buy some gloves etc., they could. She would further buy water for people in bus and sell it at cost. Again, I do not have to worry about even water here.
8.	She ran the whole trip if she owns the Joy Holiday. She most likely would not see most people again, but her enthusiasm and motherly love (not expecting anything in return) was great to see.
9.	In my earlier bus trip, I felt rushed from one spot to other, and it felt like we were using lot of time during the day on bus. I kind of expected that in this trip, knowing that we have to cover 6-8 National Parks and Monument; however, I did not feel that feeling of rush here. Mind you, that many days we have to wake by 4 AM, and being in bus by 5 AM or 6 AM; this was done so that we can reach the premium spots at sunrise or just before sunrise, beat other tour buses and enjoy the park ourselves. This trip felt much different, where in most spots, I did not feel that I did not have enough time to see the parks (apart from Zion NP ‚Äì which I felt was little rushed because of too much traffic).
10.	Finally, she knew the spots and timings when and where to take photos, and in most spots, she would patiently take family photos at premium spots; and at end of the day, she would share her on photos taken on that day, through Whatsapp. Let‚Äôs be honest, these photos really make you star among your friends.
I hope other tour guides learn from her, however, unless they really love their job, it is difficult to emulate Mama. Thank you very much !!!!!!!!< /text>< pics>

<time>1504329450874< /time><rating>5</rating>< Review>
I took my parents to the Yellowstone and Mount Rushmore 7days trip. Highly recommended! Guide Guo Ma (Lankun Weidner) and driver Quincy are the best tour guide and driver we ever had!

Quincy is great. He always loads and unloads everyone's luggages by himself. Whenever you are ready, your luggage is ready. He's such an experienced driver, safe and sound. He's also fun, gave us lots of laughter. He would sacrifice his break time to buy cases of bottle water and just sell for $1 every 4 bottles. It's for everyone's convenience.

Guo Ma is so knowledgeable and patient. She truly cares everyone in the group. We learned so much background stories during the long drive, which made lot of sightseeings more fun. Our group was a mix of both English speakers and Chinese speakers. Guo Ma will tell every story or explain details in both languages. It doubles her work. For those who don't read English at all, she helped them to connect WiFi, recorded videos to show how to use coffee pot in room, how to use shower, etc. Yes, she's that considerate!  By the way, Guo Ma is a wonderful photographer. She helps to take photos for everyone. She knows the best photo spots, takes good photos , and even adjusts every photo before sending to you.

I especially want to express my deepest appreciation to Guo Ma for taking care of my senior parents. My mom had a fall in hotel room. Her head hit the door hinge and bled a lot. That was the night before Yellowstone . Guo Ma helped to send my mom to the nearest ER and stayed for the whole time. She even arranged someone to take care of my dad as he was alone in hotel room. Luckily my mom was ok. It was just a big cut, nothing worse. We went back to hotel at around 1 am. Guo Ma didn't get much sleep that night because the departure time was 5 am. Yet, the day at Yellowstone was fantastic. Guo Ma's guide was still the same high quality: full of fun stories, picture taking for everyone, lots of tips and reminders... You wouldn't even notice she was exhausted (I know she was!) Thank you Guo Ma!</Review>

<rate>5</rate>< text>
Overview:
We just finished a 7-day (9/24-30) Yellowstone-Arches-Bryce Canyon-Antelope Canyon (and more) tour (YA7) with Lankun and Quincy.
It has been an amazing experience.
Efficient use of time allowed us to visit many stunning places.
However the trip wouldn‚Äôt have been this extraordinary if it wasn‚Äôt for the exceptional team - Lankun and Quincy.

Facts:
I read all 73 yelp reviews of JH before I started mine.  I agree with *all* of the heart-felt comments in the positive reviews for Lankun and Quincy.  For the benefit of future readers let me add more details ‚Äì because there are so so many.

For each destination time was allotted for everyone to walk the trail not rushed, enjoy the scenery and take photos.

A lot of thoughts went into the itinerary jigsaw puzzle so that we could see sunrise, sunset, different animals at the right time and at the right place.

The bus is Lankun‚Äôs moving classroom - her passion for learning and travel shined through.  She prepared tons of materials.  In addition to plenty of talking along the way she posted the written version to the group chat.   She annotated the park map with the places that we visited.  At the end of the tour she posted the trip stats such as miles traveled and states/parks/canyons/rivers/lakes visited.

Lankun speaks fluent English and mandarin.  She communicated *everything* in both.  If you don‚Äôt speak Chinese you won‚Äôt feel a bit left out.  If you don‚Äôt speak English she‚Äôll even connect your wifi and order your meal for you.

We watched documentaries by BBC and History channel about our destinations.

In between major destinations Lankun frequently pointed out sceneries, landmarks or animals on the roadside.  Whenever possible Quincy would slow down or make impromptu stops for us to take bonus photos.

The seamless teamwork between Lankun and Quincy was nice to watch. They both are compassionate and upbeat.  They took good care of us and each other.

Quincy‚Äôs driving is silky smooth on the winding mountain road.  The bus was kept spotless as our home away from home.

Lankun kept everyone‚Äôs seat rotated.  She stressed punctuality but never made people who came back late alienated.

Before each photo stop Lankun offers advice (based on her frequent visit) from what equipment to bring (if you have many) to what filter to use on your iphone, Samsung or ipad.

Before each hike Lankun told you how many bottles of water to bring and what kind of hat is a must.

Well-in-advance we get liquid-intake advisories and bathroom stop forecast.

We have endless drinking water supply on the bus with nominal price.

Snack/breakfast restocking stops at wal-mart/supermarket are planned along our route with quantity and what-to-buy suggestions.

There are options at most of the meal stops with suggestions of what to order.

Through planning Quincy and Lankun always managed to get us to the restaurant before the ‚Äúconvoy.‚Äù   Lankun even called the restaurant owner in advance so that special veggie dishes could be prepared just for us.

Hot water is important for many Chinese travelers.  Before each stop Lankun told you whether you can get hot water and exactly where the tap is located.

Before arriving at each hotel we already know how to connect its wifi and where to find microwave or breakfast the next morning.

During the down time on the bus several well-selected movies (with subtitle) were played.

As if this is not impressive enough Lankun did all that while 5-month pregnant!

We would go on another trip with Lankun and Quincy in a heartbeat.

However it was disheartening to read about the bad experiences other travelers had with *many* other JH tour guides.  I don‚Äôt understand the disparate quality within the same company.

Since there is no way to ensure that our trip is led by guide/driver we love when we book the trip the next one probably won‚Äôt happen.  Lankun and Quincy ‚Äì you have set the bar so high and I double there will ever be a match.  We are just glad that we got *so* lucky this time ‚Äì thank you both!<//text>

<review>We joined a 7 days with Joyholiday.The trip was more than just a family vacation to get rid of the usual routines of life, it was an educational one. Our tour guide Lankun made it so. She balanced mandarin and english equally and she explained as much as one could,  the significance of the places we were visiting. Moreover the documentaries she picked gave us a better picture of these places and their history. I think it is important to know as much as you can about the places you are about to visit in order to make the most out of the travel and feel the place. Lankun did just that, although we can only learn so much in a 7 day tour, her being guide made possible for us get the perfect summary of the things we ought to know of these places. Lankun's taste in movies and music is exceptional. She managed the trip very smoothly in spite of some technical troubles, we never felt stressed at all. I loved the food, we had couple of options but the Chinese restaurants (mostly buffets) were very tasty and affordable as well. <Review>(Translated by Google) "Joy Holiday" travel company:

We participated in the seven-day tour of the Southwest Giant Ring of your company (4/16--4/22). We were deeply impressed by the high-quality service of tour guide Guo Wei and driver Quincy. We have participated in many travel teams. Their service is at the top level and has some characteristics.
Guo has a deep tour guide skills, and can use fluent bilingualism to explain the human geography history of the scenic spots clearly, without repeating the burden. Guo has a strong organizational ability, and the implementation of the itinerary plan is relatively accurate, so that everyone has enough time to take pictures of the landscape, the degree of tightness is just right; for older travelers to make additional safety reminders from time to time. Guo's service gives everyone a very warm feeling, such as helping tourists take pictures, helping passengers buy drinking water, change money, play some relevant film and television materials and movies on the road, and send various infos to you via WeChat. Guo Dao asked everyone to wait for the card to be issued in the car is a very good way, very orderly.
The driver Quincy's driving is stable and safe. In memory, there is no emergency braking. The window glass is clean, so that everyone can take pictures from the car. When getting off the bus, he arranges the passenger's luggage neatly and conveniently for everyone to find the extract. When you got off the car, everyone got the room card, so the "divided team" was very fast.
We are very grateful to the two of them for their service, thank you for their professionalism, and thank you for cultivating such an excellent service team. We will participate in the future and introduce others to join your line.

In Las Vegas

< review>
The crust is crispy and and light, but not too thin - it held all my 5 toppings just right. Nice quality ingredients, and plenty of it!! Very good pizza, and nice price, too.

The wings were also delicious. They were on the smaller side, which I prefer when they are extra meaty with small bones. And the ranch dipping sauce is the Ken‚Äôs brand, my favorite!

Nice staff, well-ventilated and clean interior. I didn‚Äôt come home smelling like pizza after waiting 20 minutes for my carryout meal.<//review>

<review>I'm happy to report that Anthony and the mechanics made good on their promise to find the new rebuilt transmission leak and they did.  Apparently on the Infiniti there's three seals on the right side alone and one of those required replacement. The transmission is Ironclad it feels wonderful to the touch of my gas pedal.

They stayed the course and honored their warranty on all parts and services.

I highly recommend EDCO for your transmission needs.

===================================

Previous experience:
The owner and employees are nice and friendly, unfortunately my 2015 Infiniti QX60 transmission has not been completely fixed.  I spent over $5200 on an after market transmission that leaked from its right side within a week of repair.

After the second visit another 2 weeks later, Anthony said it would be an easy fix with a drain plug replacement and it still leaked from the right side.

After the 3rd visit 2 weeks later, they replaced a seal and it's still leaking, and now even more than before.

Upon notifying Anthony of the problem today he did not voice getting the problem fixed or address me with any apologies.  It's as if we're passed the honeymoon phase and I cannot recognize why we're married into this when there's no sense of concern or urgency.

I implore ownership, Anthony and the shop mechanics to get the job done right.

Time and money have been lost and confidence is following shortly.

Updates to follow.<//review><gmapID>0x808515cbb9b59b71:0xa18198d1cabc6096<//gmapID>< resp>

<gmap_id>0x80c299b1e5ec1335:0x3c75b1556c8eb77c< /gmap_id>< review>
Earlier this year, I needed an ITIN and while I know I could have done this entirely by myself, I would rather pay somebody who knows the system to do the bulk of the work for me than struggle through government websites and forms myself.

After doing a bit of research, I came across EIN Express and they seemed to offer the service I needed, at a price I was willing to pay.

For the most part, I worked with Sina Bonabi, who guided me through the process from start to finish, both via Skype calls and email.

It was an easy process, with no hiccoughs, and although it took longer than usual to be issued with my ITIN, this was entirely because of delays caused by the coronavirus scare (e.g. staffing shortages in the relevant government department), and not because of any problems with Sina and his company.

So, if you‚Äôre looking for somebody to work with you to obtain a tax identification number, I would highly recommend using their ITIN Service. (They offer other services too, such as the formation of an LLC or Corporation, obtaining an EIN, and opening US bank accounts, but I haven‚Äôt used those so cannot comment on them yet.)< /review>

< Text>
In 2019 I came to America and decided I wanted to open an online store. I did some research and came upon Mollaei Law and I spoke a representative who explained everything to and I paid the necessary fees. I contracted them to register my business and to apply for my ITIN and EIN number. Within a few days my business was registered but because of the pandemic the EIN and ITIN were delayed for a couple of months.  Overall the service and experience was very professional and excellent as they normally follow up and keep in touch with emails and phone calls and I would definitely be using their service again in the near future. Keep up your great service.< /Text>

< Text>
I came across Sina Bonabi and the EIN Express service via google search. After a lot of research I got in touch and was very very impressed by the level of customer service and attention I received. It was an easy decision after that. I am a foreigner living outside the US and needed my ITIN for corporate use. Honestly I was stressed and overwhelmed about the processing being that I have not had previous dealings with the IRS. Sina and the team were friendly, encouraging and uber professional. The wait time understandably was far longer than expected, due to COVID of course but Sina gave me regular updates, always responded within 24 hours and honestly the process was so smooth and uncomplicated thanks to their team. I will be in need of a EIN in the future and there is no doubt I will be using Sina and EIN Express team for this as well. Highly highly recommend this service for anyone who needs support with applying for an ITIN or EIN.</Text>

He is super attentive and dedicated and will treat your case/problem as his own and will never give any false promises to take you in confidence.

<text>In tough times you need people to step up to the plate.  Covid is and has not been an easy road not only on personal levels but business as well.  I placed a request to get an ITIN number back in November 2020. Went through the whole process of supplying all the requirements they need to process my request and then things at the US Government started to slow down.  In constant communication with Sina's team, they kept advising me that they were processing requests for specific months at a time.  I finally got my ITIN at the end of January 2021.  During all this time Sina personally responded back and kept me in the loop and was super professional about it - as was I. <text>Under very unfavorable circumstances, due to health emergency, we started to seek for a service to obtain the ITIN.   EIN Express appeared as an option on the searches.  We doubted at first about paying, but the benefits of obtaining the ITIN are worth the money.
I live in Mexico and I have been unable to travel to the US this year.  As soon as I paid,  I was contacted by Mr Sina Bonabi in a very short amount of time.
After working in my case via Skype and emails, it took me some time to gather some information, and  for about 4 weeks with a limited staff on their end,  during times of the health emergency,  they were able to successfully submit to the IRS all my forms for processing.  They gave me updates in a timely manner and kept me informed of all changes and progress in my applications during times in which many businesses were closed.  Sina and Bridget never stopped responding my numerous emails to inquire about my case.   All meetings started sharp on time, most of my emails were replied withing 24 hours or much less.
As soon as the IRS was able to catch up with all applications submitted during the pandemic, mine was processed and I received an email from Sina with a notification that my ITIN was issued.

<Name>Jeff Midler</Name><review>I was looking to start a company and reached out on FB to friends/fam for a lawyer reference. Shortly after I saw an add for Mollaei Law. I checked out their site and their reviews. The site honestly put me off a bit at first, but their reviews were on point so I decided to give it a try.

The scheduling aspect was very easy, I got an email clearly outlining the expectations from me as well as a calendar invite. It's novel but I like that they went so far to make sure you clearly understood the expectations and had a set date/time to meet. This first appointment was a short block designed to assess my needs, it was free and the gentleman I spoke to was very professional and knowledgeable. He was able to answer all of my questions and I felt confident about proceeding.

The price honestly was a little on the steeper end but I do feel I got my value out of it and going in I had no idea what this sort of service should cost so I made no effort to haggle. The price was affordable and reasonable for this type of service. All registration fee's and everything was included in the one quoted price so it was really nice not to have any sort of hidden or last minute "fees".

The registration only took about a week which was great, they sent over all the documentation for everything when they were done (so I didn't have to wait for a package in the mail or anything). I was able to confirm on the state secretary website for my state and I saw my business there, everything looks to be in standing order.

Post registration they have continued to support me as well via email chains which is great since as a new business owner I have a lot of questions!

Overall I had a great experience and would definitely recommend using them and can see hiring them for additional services in the future.<//review>< GmapID>

<Text>I've been planning to get an ITIN number for a few years now; yet, I've always hesitated when I was required to sign tax forms and send my passport to the IRS office in the US considering it'd remain there for a couple of months. Then later I wouldn't have any chance to communicate with anyone for assistance or inquire about the status of the process.

Sina Bonabi through their ITIN Service gave me full confidence to start the process with their professional team. Since the moment the order went through, the service was great, they gave me phone calls inquiring for more personal information, set up an appointment for ID validation, informed updates through emails and I was NOT required to send my passport anywhere which was a BIG plus. Later, they were kind enough to send me photos of the IRS letter once I was assigned an ITIN number.

I'd definitely recommend their EIN Express and ITIN Service to anyone that is considering getting an ITIN number. Special thanks again to Sina Bonabi, Bridget Lopez and Mo Hajr for their support and assistance.< /Text><Rating>5<//Rating>< UserId.>

< Review>
I highly recommend Mollaei Law to everyone that is looking to start a new business.  I worked with Sam and Robert and both were first class when it came down to answering all of my questions.  Sam was on top of every email I sent him and believe me since I am new to all this I had quite a few.  He was patient, prompt, professional and very informative.  The process went smoothly and really fast and what I liked the most is that I did not contacted them once ask for updates, they were that fast and efficient providing updates via email on their process every step of the way.  It took around 2 weeks.  The services they did for me were a formation of my LLC and Resale Certificate.
My experience was amazing. If you are on the fence about hiring them, don't be. Hire them you won‚Äôt regret it.

< Text>
I highly recommend Mollaei Law to everyone that is looking to start a new business.  I worked with Sam and Robert and both were first class when it came down to answering all of my questions.  Sam was on top of every email I sent him and believe me since I am new to all this I had quite a few.  He was patient, prompt, professional and very informative.  The process went smoothly and really fast and what I liked the most is that I did not contacted them once ask for updates, they were that fast and efficient providing updates via email on their process every step of the way.  It took around 2 weeks.  The services they did for me were a formation of my LLC and Resale Certificate.

< review>
It‚Äôs not a pleasant experience to discover you‚Äôve just spent US$400 on something you probably don‚Äôt need‚Ä¶ especially if you spent it online.

I discovered this pretty quickly in my introductory phone call with Sina Bonabi. To my immense relief, Sina went on to say that he would refund my money if it indeed turned out I did not need an ITIN or EIN.

Sina then connected me with Mollaei Law‚Äôs tax accountant, Angie Ortega. I was reluctant to potentially waste Angie‚Äôs time. But Sina insisted, writing, ‚ÄúAngie is the best person I know who can explain everything, answer your questions, and advise you on your situation. Our goal is to help people. You‚Äôre not wasting our time.‚Äù

I learned a *lot* from my call with Angie, and she confirmed what Sina had told me and then some. It turns out I should be applying for an ITIN in approximately three years‚Äô time.

When I emailed Sina to request the refund, it was processed in *less than a day*. A small admin fee was charged; the insights I gained from Sina and Angie were worth much more.

Every one of my interactions with Mollaei Law exceeded my expectations. I don‚Äôt expect strangers I‚Äôm dealing with online to be so kind, and it is rare to find a company as ethical as this firm. This is the main reason I would recommend Mollaei Law to anyone who needs (or thinks they need) an ITIN or EIN. On top of that, Sina and Angie are definitely experts in the field. You can‚Äôt find this information on the internet ‚Äì I tried!

Thank you, Mollaei Law. :)</review>

<user_id>114244056290849951235<//user_id>< user_name>
Ethan Adams</user_name>
< date>
1554730228754</date>
<rating>2< /rating>< Text>
Summary: As a US citizen, the services provided are not worth the amount paid. If you are starting a business and want an expensive checklist then this is for you.

I wanted to start a small business, but had no idea where to start. I came across Sam's website and it seemed as though he did everything required to help get set up. I asked a few additional questions about his services and although his responses were vague, I thought, "I'm willing to sacrifice this money to avoid making any mistakes."

I paid Sam, and he filed for my LLC that night. The next day I received an email with the certificate, and a couple of documents. The documents looked like they were more or less a template that could be copy/pasted. But it would have taken me a long time (if I even found out what papers I needed) and I was grateful.

He also sent me a checklist of other items I needed to do for compliance in my state. I tried to complete this and didn't know some of the answers to the questions. But each time I asked Sam about my state's requirements he told me he didn't deal with those specific concerns but that if I followed the steps he provided, I would be okay. Then he asked if I would leave a review.

After a few times of asking questions that were not directly answered and being asked to leave a review each time, I explained that I felt like I paid a lot of money and hadn't received much help. He replied that he did everything he promised. Considering the package is called "Start a business", what he promised was somewhat misleading. He listed out that he filed for the company, and drafted the Articles of Organization, etc. I did not know what else it took to start a business, and the site leaves out the fact that there is actually a lot more to do after you "start a business". So I told him, yes, you did everything you told me you would do, however, I explained that his site was vague in certain areas, and I would post an honest review so people are aware of what they are getting into.

He responded with an email saying "Why are you giving me a hard time at this point?" This didn't seem very professional, I was not being rude or threatening, just telling him what some of my pain points were so he could have a chance to address them. I told him I was just trying to get his side before posting my review, and reminded him he had stated that "My service also comes with a 100% Money-Back Guarantee: if you're not satisfied with my service for any reason, just let me know within 30 days and I will issue you a full refund of the service fee." (Direct from the website and email), and told him that I was not satisfied and would like my money back. He did not respond.

Four days later, I emailed and told him I was leaving a review, and he responded within thirty minutes. He told me that his money back guarantee is typically for clients who he hasn‚Äôt completely rendered the service for. But from now on, in order not to upset anyone like me, he will remove the Money Back Guarantee.

In conclusion, it seems he deals primarily with people that are foreign to the US. Maybe his services for them are great. Personally If I am paying as much as I did, I would expect my business to be operational and to be able to sell when 'service is fully rendered' by a company that sells a package titled 'start a business'.< /Text>

<response>{'time': 1566999546792, 'text': 'Thanks for the awesome review, Marilyn! I am glad to meet your expectations towards my service. Let me know if there is anything I can help you with.\n\n-Sam Mollaei, Esq.'}<//response>< Review>
I purchased a business in July 2019.  Through this purchase, I was provided with contact information for Sam Mollaei, from Mollaei Law, to establish my LLC.  I am Canadian, and my business was through an American Company.  Therefore, I had no idea what was required, or needed to be done.

Sam was very courteous, and extremely helpful in answering all my questions.  He guided me through the whole procedure, and made it a lot easier than it would have been if I had tried to do things myself.  He answered all my questions, usually on the same day asked, and helped me with any forms that needed filling out.  My favorite part was that he did most of the work; I just had to give him my information.  I would not have been able to set up my business without Sam's help.  Even after his job was done, he still came to my rescue when the bank I was dealing with needed a specific letter.

Sam was great, and I would recommend his services to anyone.

Marilyn<//Review>

< Text>
I purchased a business in July 2019.  Through this purchase, I was provided with contact information for Sam Mollaei, from Mollaei Law, to establish my LLC.  I am Canadian, and my business was through an American Company.  Therefore, I had no idea what was required, or needed to be done.

Sam was very courteous, and extremely helpful in answering all my questions.  He guided me through the whole procedure, and made it a lot easier than it would have been if I had tried to do things myself.  He answered all my questions, usually on the same day asked, and helped me with any forms that needed filling out.  My favorite part was that he did most of the work; I just had to give him my information.  I would not have been able to set up my business without Sam's help.  Even after his job was done, he still came to my rescue when the bank I was dealing with needed a specific letter.

Sam was great, and I would recommend his services to anyone.

Marilyn<//Text>

<Name>Jackie Martinez<//Name>< Review>
This is the first business I am starting. I was extremely overwhelmed with the thought of even starting my own business, I didn't know where to even begin. I was scrambling all over YouTube getting information from so many different angles and though I did learn a lot in the process there was so much information and so many different opinions on how things should get done. I was becoming discouraged because I didn't know what direction was the right direction for me, plus it was people from all different states and when you're starting a business you should follow the laws in your own state.
I happened to run across Sam's website and I am so glad I did! He is reliable and stays on top of everything, you don't have to hound him with emails checking on things. He communicates constantly and answers your questions within a few hours. He makes you feel like you are his only client. He made the entire LLC process so so easy. I literally just sat back and had piece of mind that everything was getting properly done in a timely matter. I will now hire Sam to trademark my business name. And I will definitely come back to him for future business endeavors.
Thank you so much Sam, for making this possible for me.</Review>

< review>
Very good service. Sam Mollaei opened an LLC for us. Some of the items included in the invoice were not covered as expected, like:
- Advise on how we can open our U.S. bank account
- Post-Incorporation Advice & Support (secrets, forms, deadlines, top 10 secrets to increase chance of success)
For example, that information was not provided, and we asked him to open a bank account for us or to create a template for a service agreement to use with our clients, and everything had an extra charge. However, overall the experience was good.
We also worked with Sina Bonabi, from EIN Express. We asked him for the ITIN Service, to create an ITIN for our LLC manager. Again, very good service, and he also took care of re-contacting the IRS to fix a mistake on our ITIN letter (mistake made by the IRS not by Sina) at no extra charge.
I would recommend Mollaei Law and EIN Express services.< /review>

<name>Ombm Mob</name><Review>Applying for ITIN number? Look no further, you came to the right place. EIN EXPRESS, ITIN SERVICES and MR. SINA BONABI.

I came across their company through google. I was so desperate on how to correct the errors that H&R Block did to me and my husband.
So fast forward Sina emailed me for a video meeting, and so we did several times and walked me through the detailed step by step process and timeline. i really appreciate how professional he is. He responds through my skype and emails if i have queries.
My application was a bit complicated to begin with. i checked the company reviews. just to make sure i won't make a mistake again, and that i will be in good hands.
So i gave it a go and gave my full trust to Sina.
Few weeks later i received a mail from the IRS and voila i got my ITIN Number.
I can't tell you how happy i was when i got the mail.

I highly recommend EIN EXPRESS, ITIN SERVICES and special mention to MR. SINA BONABI.

Thank you very much.
Happy Client from The Philippines,

<text>If you want to self publish and need an ITIN you need to read this. It could take a while for the ITIN but believe me its worth it.
I contacted EIN EXPRESS when i needed an ITIN in order to self publish with Amazon.
I know when people look at the price and think is it worth it? I can say it really is.
I got a response very fast from a gentleman called Sina Bonabi who asked me all about why i needed an ITIN and how the procedure works.
He emailed me some forms to fill out and mail them to his address where he would send them off to the IRS. Everything seemed to be going well until the letter came through the door saying that the IRS have rejected the application. I emailed Sina straight away and he responded that he had the news as well.
The IRS rejected my application because of the ITIN cover letter from Amazon. All Amazon do if you ask for a written cover letter is send you a self generated one which will get rejected.
So Sina got busy trying to contact Amazon and speak to one of their main guys who no one can get hold of and he also tried getting the IRS to overturn the decision. I tried asking multiple self publishing companies to write me the cover letter i needed but they all refused or said they have a different way. After a while i contacted Sina who was sky high with work and trying to balance his life trying to fix all the applications that had been rejected. He told me we can go round a different route that doesn't need a cover letter. It was brilliant and we got the ball rolling again and filled out some other forms.
After waiting patiently for so long and myself keep emailing and bothering Sina, the ITIN finally arrived and Sina contacted me over Skype to show me it's all done. Sina Bonabi has been absolutely brilliant over the last year with responding to my emails and helping me get my ITIN. Would also like to thank Sam Mollaei at EIN EXPRESS as well, plus their assistants for all their hard work.
Its very hard to get an ITIN on your own because of the cover letter situation now and the IRS. Most likely if you fill it out and send it off on your own it will get rejected. So having these two guys Sina Bonabi and Sam Mollaei at EIN EXPRESS they make the process so much easier as they are qualified and really know their legal stuff.</text><Pictures>None< /Pictures><response>{'time': 1565275793191, 'text': 'Michael, thank you so much for taking the time to leave this excellent review! <username>Thierry Bertrand</username><Date>1563953265280<//Date><Rating>5<//Rating><review>I start by saying a big thank you to Sina Bonabi. Thanks to you brother, I FINALLY got my ITIN number.

I needed an ITIN number for my internet activities and for months I tried to get one on my own ... without success. I sent mails by DHL, by post and never the IRS seemed to receive them. Certainly a problem with the right address or the right department.

Then, after a few hours of research on the internet, I found many providers on the internet. I had doubts at first because I did not know if it was possible on the internet. Some providers were cheaper than EIN Express. However, EIN Express seemed more professional, so I tried it.

After the first step, I immediately received a message from Sina Bonabi who invited me to make an appointment on Skype. During the appointment everything went well. He was patient, caring and made efforts to understand my approximate English :-). Sina accompanied me throughout the process, he helped me find the right documents for me.

Once the process was completed, I received my number after only 5 weeks.

I have already recommended the service around me. Thanks again to EIN Express for this professional and fast service.

< Review>
This is a scam!! Look up "Registered Agent in your State" and you will see plenty of companies that are 1/3 the price of what these people are offering. Don't fall for it, I almost did before doing research. This guy is using his lawyer credentials to make you think that you need a lawyer to start a business. You don't need a lawyer!! If you look at the responsibilities of a registered agent they will exactly match with the services that this company offers. Again, SCAMM!!!! Stay away.< /Review>

< review>
Sam helped me set up an LLC for an art business when I came to him with only half a notion about how to go about that. He was very open and helpful, answering all my questions and walking me through the process. He responded to every email the same day I sent it, and was proactive in letting me know when paperwork was filed, when it was accepted, and what to do after that.

I couldn't be happier with the help I received. Although it is technically possible to set up an LLC yourself I was not at all comfortable doing that, knowing almost nothing about the process and finding information online confusing, not knowing what to trust. Hiring Sam to guide me through that process and make sure it was done correctly and completely was well worth the cost.

If you are thinking of forming a small business entity, even if it is for some weird creative niche, I highly recommend talking to Sam. He could not have been more professional or more helpful.< /review>

< text>
Mine was a somewhat difficult case for various reasons. I had unsuccessfully tried to apply for an ITIN on my own three times. Unlike other countries I have worked with in East Asia and Europe, the IRS have absolutely no-one on staff to deal with and/or help with questions related to the application.

<Date>1535788076276<//Date>< rate>
5< /rate>
< text>
Mine was a somewhat difficult case for various reasons. I had unsuccessfully tried to apply for an ITIN on my own three times. Unlike other countries I have worked with in East Asia and Europe, the IRS have absolutely no-one on staff to deal with and/or help with questions related to the application.

Luckily I found EIN Express and Sina and they came through for me. It was not a one-week-and-it's-done fast process but neither was it slow... - as mentioned above, my situation was tricky. Sina talked to his contacts, helped me through the process and with processing my application to the IRS. I now have my ITIN. And I sincerely believe without a question of a doubt that I got it faster from EIN Express than I would have from any other similar provider of said service.

Thank you, Sina, for all your help and for getting me my ITIN when I honestly thought all hope was lost!</text>

Mine was a somewhat difficult case for various reasons. I had unsuccessfully tried to apply for an ITIN on my own three times. Unlike other countries I have worked with in East Asia and Europe, the IRS have absolutely no-one on staff to deal with and/or help with questions related to the application.
